p: The flying animals (wild birds and chiroptera) were captured using mist nets which were opened at dawn (4:00 a.m.) and closed in the morning (9:00 a.m.) and were inspected every one hour until the closing, with a sampling effort of 15 days. This research was approved by National Council for Animal Control and Experimentation (CONCEA), System of Authorization and Information in Biodiversity—SISBIO/ICMBIO/Ministry of the Environment under No. 37174–1 and by Committee on Ethics in Animal Use (CEUA / IEC) No. 019/2014.
